channel.title: Nature Communications
channel.description:
Nature Communications is an open access, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, health, physical, chemical and Earth sciences. Papers published by the journal aim to represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

We are committed to providing an efficient service for both authors and readers. Our team of independent editors make rapid and fair publication decisions. Prompt dissemination of accepted papers to a wide readership and beyond is achieved through a programme of continuous online publication.
channel.dc:rights: © 2025 Macmillan Publishers Limited, part of Springer Nature. All rights reserved.

item.title: High-κ dielectric van der Waals integration on 2D semiconductors for three-dimensional complementary logic systems
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-66770-0

The integration of high-κ dielectric materials with 2D semiconductors remains an important challenge for the implementation of post-silicon 2D electronics. Here, the authors report a HfSe2 plasma oxidation method to integrate HfO2 dielectric layers on both n- and p-type 2D semiconducting channels, showing the realisation of high-performance complementary electronic devices.
item.dc:title: High-κ dielectric van der Waals integration on 2D semiconductors for three-dimensional complementary logic systems
item.dc:creator: Taeho Kang
Joonho Park
Seung Yong Lee
Hanggyo Jung
Jongwook Jeon
Yong-Hoon Kim
Sungjoo Lee

item.title: Nonconventional near-infrared room-temperature phosphorescent materials based on spiropolymer alloy
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-66035-w

Most near-infrared room-temperature phosphorescent (NIR-RTP) materials are highly conjugated, requiring complex synthesis and resulting in poor processability. Here, the authors demonstrate the synthesis of a short-conjugated polymer via multicomponent spiropolymerization and blended it with polystyrene, achieving NIR-RTP polymers with good processability and high Stokes shift.
item.dc:title: Nonconventional near-infrared room-temperature phosphorescent materials based on spiropolymer alloy
item.dc:creator: Yue Ren
Yongfeng Zhang
